urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK’s Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.

urls.title: Work to start on £1 million Flimby flood protection scheme
urls.description: Work is due to start on a £1 million flood protection scheme in Flimby in the spring. The project will reduce the risk of flooding to properties in the village, near Maryport, which has been badly affected by flooding in the past. Storm Desmond in December 2015 caused significant damage...

text:
The Flimby flood protection scheme is due to start in spring and includes a detention basin in a farmers field and construction of additional dams to slow the flow in woodland to the east of Flimby. #NFM #Slowtheflow #flimby @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC
